qas.question: Who advanced on Dobruja in the spring of 1854?
What river did the Russians cross to get to Dobruja?
How man troops did the Russians have when they attacked Silistra ?
When did the siege of Silistra end?
Why couldn't the French and English take control of the field?

context: In the spring of 1854 <a0_0>the Russians<a0_0/> again advanced, crossing the <a1_0>Danube River<a1_0/> into the Turkish province of Dobruja. By April 1854, the Russians had reached the lines of Trajan's Wall where they were finally halted. In the center, the Russian forces crossed the Danube and laid siege to Silistra from 14 April with <a2_0>60,000 troops<a2_0/>, the defenders with 15,000 had supplies for three months.:415 The siege was lifted on <a3_0>23 June 1854<a3_0/>. The English and French forces at this time were unable to take the field for <a4_0>lack of equipment<a4_0/>.:415
